summary: John J. Moriarty was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He appears in payroll and certification reports from April 1978 to December 1978. The documents list his name, social security number, annual salary, and gross pay during the specified periods. The documents do not provide specific details about his role within the HSCA, but his presence on the payroll indicates he was a staff member during the committee's investigation.
significance: John J. Moriarty's significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating his involvement in the investigation into the JFK assassination, although the specific nature and impact of his role are not detailed in these documents.
